Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $111,000 - $189,000 a year Job Type Full-time Do you want to develop technology and solutions that provides customers with the advantage, pushes the technical edge, and develops new technology? Do you want to work in a diverse and inclusive environment that draws strength from and embraces our differences? Do you want to be a part of a growing company that supports teamwork, encourages personal excellence, and focuses on your career and future development? If the answer is yes, come join us! Job Summary and Description The Controls and Avionics Solutions (CAS) business is experiencing unprecedented growth. Our state of the art development center in Austin, Texas is the home for our next generation technical solutions. Engineers will provide flight and mission-critical products worldwide to more than 170 commercial and military customers. Engineers will also support securing our sustainable future through products that provide efficient, power management and by developing eco-friendly, hybrid and electric systems. You will have the opportunity to help define and develop the next generation: Fly-By-Wire Flight Controls, Full Authority Digital Engine Controls, Ground Vehicle Power Management, Aircraft Electrification, Advanced Air Mobility, Autonomous Flight Systems, Flight Deck Systems, Cabin Management Systems, Weapon Controls, and Mission Systems for the world's most prominent commercial and military aircraft and vehicle manufacturers. As a Senior Embedded Software Engineer your day to day responsibilities will include: Leadership opportunities to mentor your team and interface with customers Collaborate as an integrated team member with Systems and Hardware engineers Participation in one of more phases of the software life cycle; project planning, requirements development, software design/implementation, and integration and test Develop software designs and implementations that meet stringent requirements for complex embedded control systems Use existing processes and evolve processes to utilize the most effective new techniques to minimize both design cost and product cost Cultural and behavioral principles are a special part of our engineering organization, and we are looking for team players who will support our commitment to diversity and inclusion. Candidates for this position can expect to work in mid-size teams that are cooperative, dependable, and supportive, working in both co-located and geographically distributed environments. Come build your career with us at BAE Systems, in one of the fastest growing metropolitan cities in the US – Austin, Texas – where there is exciting work, a great place to live and the people are warm and friendly. To learn more about BAE Systems Controls and Avionics Solutions check us out at; http://www.baesystems-ps.com/interactive/cas.htm Because this role involves a combination of collaborative/in-person and independent work, it will take the form of a hybrid work format, with time split between working onsite and remotely. While onsite, the facility addresses professional and personal expectations, providing both an open and collaborative work environment and many health and wellness features. Additionally with our flexible hybrid work environment and 9/80 work schedule, you’ll have a chance to change the world without giving up your personal life. Required Education, Experience, & Skills Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD Degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or other related technical field US citizenship or US Permanent Resident Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD Degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or other related technical field BS with 6+ Years of Experience, MS/PhD with 6+ Years’ Experience Experience in any the following areas are a plus. Embedded Software development in one or more of C, C++, and Assembly programming languages Higher level programing & scripting languages such as JAVA, Perl, Matlab & Simulink etc. Low level Software Development such as:Device Firmware Device Drivers Operating System Development Processor architectures such as PowerPC, ARM, x86 Data Busses Configuration/Change Management Systems Software Requirements Creation/ Management Software Verification and Validation Hardware/Software Integration & Debug Experience in a Safety Critical or Functional Safety Real Time Embedded Electronics Experience with Safety Critical or Functional Safety industry standards About BAE Systems Electronic Systems BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems’ game-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere – from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact – for our customers and the communities we serve. Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: At BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $111,000.00 - $189,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Paid time off Retirement plan Compensation package: Signing bonus Yearly pay Experience level: 6 years Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Ability to commute/relocate: Austin, TX 78753: Reliably commute or willing to relocate with an employer-provided relocation package (Required) Work Location: Hybrid remote in Austin, TX 78753 Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
